ranked_diseases.explanation: Strong match with intellectual disability, developmental delay, microcephaly, short stature, and distinctive facial features. The prominent metopic ridge and high forehead are characteristic.
Matches intellectual disability, seizures, microcephaly, developmental delay, and gastroesophageal reflux. Facial features including high forehead are consistent.
Presents with intellectual disability, seizures, microcephaly, and severe speech delay. Gastroesophageal reflux is common. Facial features can include tented philtrum.
Features severe developmental delay, seizures, absent speech, delayed walking, and gastroesophageal reflux. Microcephaly occurs in some cases.
Includes intellectual disability, seizures, microcephaly, and developmental regression. However, typically affects females and has specific hand stereotypies not mentioned.
Characterized by severe intellectual disability, microcephaly, seizures, and delayed motor development. Cavum septum pellucidum has been reported.
Features intellectual disability, short stature, developmental delay, and distinctive facial features. High forehead and prominent metopic ridge can occur.
Presents with intellectual disability, developmental delay, speech impairment, and characteristic facial features. Seizures and gastroesophageal reflux are possible.
